msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 56 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 9; Qurʾānic Text: Q 1:1-4:11, Q 4:46; 15 lines per page; Dimensions: 175 x 112mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 21f: "62 E. H. 9. Kur’an’dan bir parça. Parşömen. 112 mm boy 170 mm eninde cönk biçiminde 56 yaprak Sahifede kûfi ile 135mm uzunl.[uğunda] 15 satır. Her ne kadar sonunda كتبه كاتب الوحي عثمان بن عفان kaydı var ise de bunun sonradan başka bir el ile yazıldığı bariz bir surette görülmektedir. Kur’an’ın III-IV. (IX- X) asırda yazılmış olması daha muhtemeldir. Bu mushafta Fatiḥa (1) dan başlayarak Nisā (4) suresinin 11. ayetinin ortasında منهما السدس مما ترك إن كا(ن) … ibaresine kadar mevcut olup aynı surenin 47. [sic] ayetinin ولكن لعنهم الله بكفرهم … ibaresine kadar eksiktir ve bu ayetin sonunda sona ermektedir. Baştaki Fātiḥa suresi de sonradan yazılmıştır. Sure başları Arap üslûbunda müzehheptir. Miklepli mor deri zilbahar Osmanlı cildi. Rûmî oymalı gümüş gilafı vardır."

This can be translated as follows: "62 E. H. 9. A part of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 56 junk shaped leaves of 112 mm height and 175 mm width. The text area, written in Kufic script [contains] 15 lines measuring 135 mm. Probably copied during the 3rd-4th (9th-10th) century. Although there is an attestation كتبه كاتب الوحي عثمان بن عفان in the same Arabic formula that this muṣḥaf was copied by [Caliph] ʿUsthmān as in the muṣḥaf no. 24 E. H. 1, it has actually been transcribed later in naskh script. Purple leather binding with flap (miklep) and a gilded mandorla (yazma şemse). The codex contains from the Q 1 (Sūra al-Fātiḥa) to the middle of the eleventh verse of Q 4 (Sūra al-Nisāʾ), up to the word منهما السدس مما ترك إن كا(ن) and it is incomplete up to ولكن لعنهم الله بكفرهم in the 47th [sic] verse of the same sūra. And it concludes at the end of this verse. Sūra al-Fātiḥa at the opening was also added later. Sūra beginnings are decorated with Arabic-style. Purple leather binding with zilbahar illuminations and flap (miklep). It has a Rūmī carved silver cover."
